evals.prompt: Write a commit message for staged changes adding OAuth login and callback validation.
evals.expected_output: Draft mode returns one copy-paste-ready Conventional Commit message with valid header shape.

evals.prompt: Rewrite this message: 'stuff changed in API'.
evals.expected_output: Rewrite mode returns a corrected message plus concise 'Why this is better' findings tied to violated rules.

evals.prompt: Review this commit message for compliance: feat(api): add v2 users endpoint.
evals.expected_output: Review mode outputs Findings first, severity ordered, and proposes a fixed message only when needed.

evals.prompt: Write a perf commit message for query cache tuning.
evals.expected_output: Unsupported type is mapped to an allowed type; in draft mode output remains a single final message without extra prose unless rationale is requested.

evals.prompt: Rewrite as conventional commit and explain mapping for type 'hotfix'.
evals.expected_output: Rewrite mode explicitly states mapping (hotfix -> fix) and returns compliant message structure.

evals.prompt: Draft a breaking change commit for removing v1 webhook payload fields and include migration notes.
evals.expected_output: Header uses ! and footer includes BREAKING CHANGE with migration impact.

evals.prompt: Split this broad change into 3 atomic commits: DB migration, API handler update, and docs update.
evals.expected_output: Response proposes atomic split with valid type/scope and concise imperative subjects.

evals.prompt: Prepare a revert commit message for commit a1b2c3d4.
evals.expected_output: Revert message clearly references reverted commit and includes 'This reverts commit <hash>.' in body.

evals.prompt: Create commit message with two tracker links and one co-author.
evals.expected_output: Footers use trailer format with one See URL per line and valid Co-authored-by trailer.

evals.prompt: Review whether this commit should include tests and note hygiene issues.
evals.expected_output: Findings cover atomicity/hygiene and test inclusion expectations when behavior changes.
